perturbation.original_text:
Customer or IBM may terminate this Agreement for material breach of this Agreement by the other upon written notice containing the
specific nature and dates of the material breach.  The breaching party will have thirty (30) days from receipt of notice to cure such
breach, except for nonpayment by Customer, which must be cured within five (5) days from receipt of notice. If such breach has not
been timely cured, then the non-breaching party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon written notice.
perturbation.changed_text:
Customer or IBM may terminate this Agreement for material breach of this Agreement by the other upon written notice containing the
specific nature and dates of the material breach.  The breaching party will have ten (10) days from receipt of notice to cure such
breach, except for nonpayment by Customer, which must be cured within two (2) days from receipt of notice. If such breach has not
been timely cured, then the non-breaching party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract specified a 30-day cure period for breaches and a 5-day cure period for nonpayment. The modified contract reduces these cure periods to 10 days and 2 days respectively. This change creates a legal contradiction because it is an unreasonably short time, depending on jurisdiction, and may be deemed unconscionable by a court, especially where significant financial or operational adjustments are needed to rectify the breach.

perturbation.original_text:
IBM invoices will specify the amount due. Payment is due and payable by month end for any invoice received by the 10th of the month,
otherwise payment is due thirty (30) days from receipt of invoice. Customer agrees to pay accordingly, including any late payment fees.
Payment will be made in United States dollars.
perturbation.changed_text:
IBM invoices will specify the amount due. Payment is due and payable within 5 days from receipt of invoice. Customer agrees to pay accordingly, including any late payment fees.
Payment will be made in United States dollars.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allowed for payment within 30 days of invoice receipt. The modified text reduces this to 5 days. This is a legal contradiction. Depending on jurisdiction, such short payment terms could be considered unreasonable or unconscionable, particularly if they deviate significantly from industry standards or impose undue hardship on the customer.

perturbation.original_text:
Actions Period
Neither party will bring a legal action related to this Agreement more than two years after the cause of action accrued.
perturbation.changed_text:
Actions Period
Neither party will bring a legal action related to this Agreement more than six months after the cause of action accrued.
perturbation.explanation: The original actions period stated that neither party could bring legal action more than two years after the cause of action accrued. The modified contract reduces this period to six months. Depending on the jurisdiction and the type of claim, a six-month limitation period could be deemed unreasonably short and conflict with statutory limitation periods.
